Articles.Content: The day .21 was released, (I heard about it and bought it)

0.19

What incredible day !! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

When i knew i could reach the stars jajaja

I remember there was still a launch tower and no rover wheels. So some time before 0.19.

Wow... 2 years and I still haven't run out of things to do.

0.17 when I joined. November 2012. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Lost my account in the great derp though. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) Never forget April 2013.

0.22. Career FTW!

I would have gotten in sooner, but I'd gotten the impression that it was more about managing a space program (like training astronauts and managing funds) than flying rockets. Flying rockets = massive fun. Managing the program = interesting diversion. Not paying for interesting diversion unless it comes with the massive fun part.

Um. 0.17? was playing the demo quite a while ( the old 0.13 one ) so I might have missed a release.

Also a victim of the forumkraken

Bought it for 40% off during a steam sale.

0.20 version of the game. Loved it, played it every day for some time, and then it pgraded to 0.21, and I loved it even more.

And 0.22 and 0.23 and 0.23.5 and 0.24 and 0.25 and 0.90. With each release I fall more and more in love with the game. I hope 1.0 delivers ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Shortly after 23.5 released.

I was sick looking for some distraction, Steam had a sale, I wasn't too impressed, discovered mods and then hundreds of hours flew by ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

0.17 or 0.18, I dont remember...

I remember moving map camera to measure angles on the screen and doing the math to reach Mun, so it has to be before maneuver nodes. Also learned the easy solution: burn when Mun rises!!

2013 forum kraken ate my account too.
It was sometime around the 0.18 release. And I have no way of checking as I too fell victim to the big forum Krunch.

0.17

From the results, seems Steam got many new users?

- - - Updated - - -

as in: KSP launching on Steam got many new KSP users. Should have been "players". Just clarifying.
First of May, 2014. Version 0.23.5 only a few weeks after it was released.
0.11(?) IIRC ... the one where they added the Mun ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

started in 0.15 (still have that version, and all others since, I'm a digital-hoarder).

It's been awesome seeing it change, and equally awesome being part of this community!

Found it on youtube while looking for Orbiter cinematics a week after .19 came out, but I didn't actually get the game until .20

EDIT: woo! 200 posts!

EDIT2: among the first videos I remember watching were: Scott Manley's Project Icarus, Scott Manley making rockets with his dad, and Insane Rockets Division episode 1 (because you have to start at the beginning)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-28T17:39:48Z" title="02/28/2015 05:39  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 28, 2015</time> by billbobjebkirk**
I had known about it since 0.14, but never got the game until the week before 0.23 came out, so I put 0.20-0.22
0.20 for me, I never played 0.21 because i decided to wait and skip straight to 0.22
Had known about it for close to a year, before the splashy 23.5 ARM update pushed me over the edge, toward Space!
I guess I technically started with the 0.18 trial, but I got the paid version right after .90 came out, so I selected that.
I learned about it during 0.14 and I joined around 0.17. Btw this data is fascinating!

I joined in 0.18.2, purchasing the game in January of 2013. KSP was a lot different then, but still really awesome. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I waited until October of 2013 to make an account, largely because I was away from home from May-August of 2013 for personal reasons.
I got it a few months before .21 came out after seeing Kurtjmac's series on it.
I'd been wanting it for ksp for ages since Nerdcubed got it but I could only buy it at 0.22

.8 or so. No Mun, no persistence, no orbital map...

Went to Mun and Minmus when they were added, but there I stopped for the longest time - other games wanted my attention, and I was waiting for certain things (like docking) to become stock. Finally ventured beyond Kerbin's SOI and started building space stations, etc, somewhere around .19 or so. Been keeping this save going since then. I'll finally start over with 1.0.
I joined 0.12, played until 0.16 then took a break "till 0.24. I missed a *lot.*
